channel.title: Data Science Portfolio on Yohan Jeong
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science Portfolio on Yohan Jeong

item.title: Project 8: Making an Item-based Collaborative Filtering
item.description: Used a sample rating dataset: 10 movies and 10 users Found similar movies to a selected movie using the NearestNeighbors() in the sklearn library which applies the cosine similarity method. Predicted the unknown rating for the movie using the weighted average of ratings for the similar movies by the user. Built a movie recommender using the algorithm and applied it to the real movie dataset. Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: Project 7: Making a Content-based Movie Recommender
item.description: Used a movie data set from the MovieLens, which has 9742 movies. Quantified the movie features using the Term Frequency and Inverse Document Frequency (tf-idf). Calculated the similarities between movies using the cosine similarity. Added the ‘Did you mean…?’ function to the recommender in order to make the searching process easier. Link to GitHub Repository Medium Post

item.title: Project 6: Cohort Analysis
item.description: Implemented the cohort analysis using eCommerce data from UIC machine learning repository Showed how to create the matrix for cohort analysis from the raw ecommerce data. Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: Project 5: The Analysis for Glassdoor Job Postings
item.description: Scraped over 3000 job postings for ‘Data Analyst’ from the Glassdoor website using the Selenium library in the Python Cleaned the scraped data using the Python. Converted the data to the format for the Relational Database to store it in the SQL format. Visualized the data using Tableau, showing the salary distributions by state, city, sector, and skills. Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: Project 4: Creating a Database and Practicing SQL Queries
item.description: Converted a data in one spreadsheet to a relational database for SQL. Performed several SQL queries using the database. Link to GitHub Repository Medium Post 1, Medium Post 2

item.title: Project 3: Predicting Housing Prices using Cross Validation and Grid Search in Regression Models
item.description: Analyze the factors related to housing prices in Melbourne and performed the predictions for the housing prices using several machine learning techniques. Employed Linear Regression, Ridge Regression, K-Nearest Neighbors, and Decision Tree. Found the optimal values for hyper parameters in each model using the methods of the Cross Validation and Grid Search techniques. Compared the results to find the best machine learning model to predict the housing prices in Melbourne.

item.title: Project 2: Analysis of Movies and their Trailer Release Dates
item.description: Scraped the Boxofficemojo and Traileraddict websites to get movie information. Explored movie features such as budget, distributors, MPAA, and genres. Examined whether the variation in the promotion period is related to such features. Link to GitHub Repository Medium Post

item.title: Contact
item.description: Follow me on these platforms: Website: https://yjeong5126.github.io/YohanJeong_Portfolio/ LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yohanjeong5126/ Medium: https://yjeong5126.medium.com/ GitHub: https://github.com/yjeong5126

item.title: Project 1: Scraping Box Office Info Using Scrapy
item.description: Scraped the Boxofficemojo website using Scrapy in Python. Checked all the movies released in the US during certain periods of time and extracted useful information about the individual movies. For each movie, Domestic Revenues, Worldwide Revenues, Distributor, Opening, Budget, MPAA, Genres, and In Release are scraped.
